title: Oroonoko
summary: Oroonoko: or, the Royal Slave is a short work of prose fiction by Aphra Behn (1640â€“1689), published in 1688  by William Canning and reissued with two other fictions later that year. It was also adapted into a play. The eponymous hero is an African prince from Coramantien who is tricked into slavery and sold to European colonists in Surinam where he meets the narrator. Behn's text is a first-person account of Oroonoko's life, love, rebellion, and execution.
